Articles.Content:
Hi, I believe I've encountered a bug caused by OPM. On Minmus, when you click the button in the right click menu to perform an experiment, the expected log for the science experiment doesn't appear, and the output log throws the following error:

Spoiler

IndexOutOfRangeException: Array index is out of range.
  at CBAttributeMapSO.GetAtt (Double lat, Double lon) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at ScienceUtil.GetExperimentBiome (.CelestialBody body, Double lat, Double lon) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at ModuleScienceExperiment+<gatherData>c__Iterator87.MoveNext () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at UnityEngine.SetupCoroutine.InvokeMoveNext (IEnumerator enumerator, IntPtr returnValueAddress) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
 

I'm not sure what triggers the issue, but i think it may be either going EVA or landing on the surface. The full output log can be found here:

 https://www.dropbox.com/s/mzqqu04ttbde8yr/output_log.txt?dl=0

This was tested using no other mods except OPM and it's required dependencies, on a Windows 7 x64 operating system. If you need any other information, just ask and I'll be happy to supply it. Thanks!

  at ModuleScienceExperiment+<gatherData>c__Iterator87.MoveNext () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at UnityEngine.SetupCoroutine.InvokeMoveNext (IEnumerator enumerator, IntPtr returnValueAddress) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
 

I'm not sure what triggers the issue, but i think it may be either going EVA or landing on the surface. The full output log can be found here:

 https://www.dropbox.com/s/mzqqu04ttbde8yr/output_log.txt?dl=0

This was tested using no other mods except OPM and it's required dependencies, on a Windows 7 x64 operating system. If you need any other information, just ask and I'll be happy to supply it. Thanks!

 

 

There is a bug in Kopernicus that is being fixed and will be released soon.

oh, ok. Thanks!

On ‎18‎/‎02‎/‎2018 at 3:18 AM, Galileo said:

There is a bug in Kopernicus that is being fixed and will be released soon. 

I have this same bug. Not sure if it helps or if you have this information already, but it also affects the 'biome' display of Kerbal Engineer Redux, both in the HUD and the Engineer panel. If 'biome' is selected as a visible piece of information, whateber it is in - be it the HUD or the panel - will disappear entirely until 'biome' is deselected as an option, then they pop up again.

Edited February 21, 2018 by bonalste

Just a quick question, do these planets have anomalies? Please answer yes or no only in a spoiler tag

Edited February 21, 2018 by Waxing_Kibbous

On 2/17/2018 at 10:18 PM, Galileo said:

There is a bug in Kopernicus that is being fixed and will be released soon. 

 

 

well hope it comes out soon I just got the same bug its a bit annoying o well wasn't going to be exploring that far out yet anyway so I can wait but cant wait for it to be fixed

Hi, I know mechjeb isnt your project but I'm hoping you can help as this mod seems to break mechjebs landing guidance on minmus. While in orbit around minmus picking a landing target does not display coordinates and only focuses on minmus. As far as I can tell, minmus is the only planet/moon affected. This link https://github.com/MuMech/MechJeb2/issues/996 will take you to the bug report I've given mechjebs creator.
https://nofile.io/f/KDOQSucmm4E/KSP.log
https://nofile.io/f/MZAWEOxsSM1/output_log.txt
With OPM

Without OPM

Edited February 25, 2018 by GhastlyKerbal

@GhastlyKerbalhave you tried without OPM and Kopernicus? If the issue persists, the problem is with mechjeb alone. If it only happens with Kopernicus and OPM installed, it could be an issue with Kopernicus and a bug report for then woul be necessary there too. I would also double check that you have the absolute latest version of mechjeb as issues like this tend to pop up every now and again then. First things first, replicate the issue with the bare minimum amount of mods installed so it’s not a nightmare for the devs to go through. If you have already done that, Great. I will take a look at your logs when I get home.

Edited February 25, 2018 by Galileo

@Galileo Uninstalling OPM fixes it enabling me to select the landing coordinates correctly so I'm fairly certain there's some sort of bug or something going on between Mechjeb and OPM. I've done as you suggested and uninstalled everything but the two of them and the problem remains. I've updated the log. https://nofile.io/f/MZAWEOxsSM1/output_log.txt

 

Edited February 25, 2018 by GhastlyKerbal

After getting some weird texture bugs with the OPM planets, I realized that I needed to update the Kopernicus mod. Upon doing so, the game began to crash before it finished loading.

This crash only happens with OPM installed, and works fine with just Kopernicus. (I'm specifically using OPM 1.2.5 and Kopernicus 1.3.1-6) I'm using quite a few other mods that I can list if you need me to, but I believe this is just an issue with OPM and Kopernicus.

Here's the "KSP.log" file.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/ryif1hr84ejfse4/KSP.log?dl=0

Thanks in advance. This is my first time dealing with a crash like this, so sorry if I'm doing something dumb or not providing the right files/info. I really like this mod and I'm glad that you're working to keep it updated and bug-free.

EDIT : Reverting to Kopernicus 1.3.1-3 will "fix" the crash issue, but not the unfortunate texture bug.

Edited February 25, 2018 by SnailsAttack

yep this looks like its caused by the same bug thats effecting biomes and throwing a lot of errors. Its a kopernicus issue and is known to the developer. A fix should be forthcoming soon.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/8fglgf63aa36o4w/Player.log?dl=0

I went ahead and gave these logs to the kopernicus dev, and neither of us can see why it would be crashing. What i can recommendis trying the latest version of kopernicus that was released to day. Maybe it will work for you then.

1 hour ago, Galileo said:

I went ahead and gave these logs to the kopernicus dev, and neither of us can see why it would be crashing. What i can recommendis trying the latest version of kopernicus that was released to day. Maybe it will work for you then.

I forgot to mention that I had started using that version when I switched from kopernicus 1.3.1-3 (the latest version of kopernicus that works) to make sure I had an accurate player.log.

Maybe I could try selectively removing different mods and see if there's some sort of weird incompatibilities. I dunno. I'll tell you if anything comes up.

Anyways, thanks for your help.

Edited February 25, 2018 by SnailsAttack

Hello.  I'm Having some issues with OPM+Scatterer.  For some reason, the only planet having issues is Sarnus.  The planet has a black circle around it where the atmosphere should be.

 

https://nofile.io/f/93MVfp53n1x/output_log.txt
I know you said it will not work with KSP 1.4, but is there a chance it will be updated to work with KSP 1.4?
